RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH:
Alessandro Tessari possui graduaчуo em Arquitetura pela Universidade IUAV de Veneza (2006) o doutorado em Urbanismo pela Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro (2016) e o doutorado em Arquitetura pelo Villard d'Honnecourt - Universidade IUAV de Veneza (2016). A tese de doutorado intitulada INFORMAL ROOTING foi agraciada com o PREMIO ANPARQ 2018 (Associaчуo Nacional de Pesquisa e Pѓs-graduaчуo em Arquitetura e Urbanismo), como melhor tese de Arquitetura e Urbanismo 2016-2018.
Alessandro Tessari foi professor visitante na Universidade de Arquitectura IUAV de Veneza (Italia), na Universidade Roma Tre, em Roma (Italia), na Universidade Catѓlica de Pereira (Colombia), na Universidade Javeriana de Bogotс (Colombia), na Escola da Cidade (Brasil); foi professor substituto na UNIFE, Faculdade de Arquitectura de Ferrara (Italia) e no Politecnico de Milуo (Italia). Alessandro Tessari deu palestras na principal Universidade de Arquitetura, incluindo o IUAV de Veneza (Italia), o Politщcnico de Milуo (Italia), a AAM de Mendrisio (Suiza), a ETSAS de Sevilha (Espanha), a FAU-UFRJ do Rio de Janeiro (Brasil), a Escola da Cidade de Sуo Paulo (Brasil) e a Pontificia Universidade Javeriana de Bogotс (Colombia) e em vсrias instituiчѕes culturais na Europa, incluindo a Bienal de Veneza e a Maison de Arquitetura de Genebra. Seus projetos foram publicados em uma ampla gama de literatura especializada e foram apresentados em diferentes exposiчѕes, incluindo a 14Њ, 15Њ e 16Њ Bienal de Arquitetura de Veneza. Alessandro Tessari ganhou vсrios prъmios internacionais por excelъncia da pesquisa como o premio ANPARQ 2018 como melhor tese de doutorado 2016-2018 e de design, incluindo o AGATV 2010, o NIB 2010 e o YIA 2012. Em 2008 fundou a firma de arquitetura internacional ETB com Matteo Bandiera, com sede em Sevilha (Espanha) e Treviso (Itсlia). Tem experiъncia na сrea de Arquitetura e Urbanismo, com ъnfase no projeto do espaчo pњblico.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN:
Alessandro Tessari has a degree in Architecture from the IUAV University of Venice (2006), a PhD in Urban Planning from the Federal University of Rio de Janeiro (2016) and a Ph.D. in Architecture from Villard d'Honnecourt - IUAV University in Venice (2016). The doctoral thesis titled INFORMAL ROOTING was awarded the ANPARQ 2018 PRIZE (National Association of Research and Postgraduate in Architecture and Urbanism), as the best thesis of Architecture and Urbanism 2016-2018.
Alessandro Tessari was a visiting professor at the University of Architecture IUAV in Venice (Italy), at Roma Tre University, in Rome (Italy), at the Catholic University of Pereira (Colombia), at the Javeriana University in Bogotс (Colombia), at the City School Brazil); he was a substitute professor at UNIFE, Faculty of Architecture of Ferrara (Italy) and Politecnico of Milan (Italy). Alessandro Tessari gave lectures at the main University of Architecture, including the IUAV in Venice (Italy), the Polytechnic of Milan (Italy), the AAM in Mendrisio (Switzerland), ETSAS in Seville (Spain), FAU-UFRJ in Rio de (Brazil), the School of the City of Sуo Paulo (Brazil) and the Pontificia Universidad Javeriana de Bogotс (Colombia) and several cultural institutions in Europe, including the Venice Biennale and the Maison de Architecture in Geneva. His projects were published in a wide range of specialized literature and were presented at different exhibitions, including the 14th, 15th and 16th Venice Architecture Biennale. Alessandro Tessari has won several international awards and design prizes including AGATV 2010, NIB 2010 and YIA 2012. In 2008 he founded the international architecture firm ETB with Matteo Bandiera, based in Seville (Spain) and Treviso (Italy) ). Has experience in the area of ​​Architecture and Urbanism, with emphasis on the public space project.

The pandemic has highlighted the extent to which our built environment (houses, schools, hospitals, and public space) is unable to cope with this tragic event. Similarly, our urban realm has been shown to be inadequate in confronting the other dangers we face, such as the climate crisis or the fragility of the environment. In these situations, architecture is given the task of imagining and designing the environments and places that will frame our lives: not just buildings for the few ? expensive, bespoke and for limited areas of the world or of the city ? but solutions that improve the quality of life for the greatest possible number of people. These solutions must also be able to interpret the characteristics of diverse places and climates without renouncing architecture?s creativity and history.

Our current situation, which has put many of our everyday activities on hold, can be an important opportunity to rethink our way of life. As is the case every year, Wave will act not only as important international learning activity for the participating students, but as a collective laboratory addressing current themes. What theme could be more topical than the terrible disease that has affected the entire planet?

Wave 2020 will be the first architectural workshop to focus on post-Covid scenarios, a subject that is bound to occupy architects and urban planners in the coming years. The viewpoint of the architects and urban planners who will participate from different continents and who, together with the students, are living in this present condition, will give rise ? as it does every year ? to the development and exchange of a vast number of ideas and solutions. Once again, this prestigious architectural design workshop will demonstrate how architecture can be a tool for both understanding and improving the world.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O trabalho parte da constataчуo de que estс em ato a nэvel global um processo de enraizamento, nas metrѓpoles contemporтneas, das cidades informais que se estruturam sobre si mesmas e permanecem e se sedimentam no imaginсrio coletivo produzindo uma inщdita mutaчуo sociocultural. Esta mudanчa de paradigma gera sempre mais difusamente processos de ?nуo substituiчуo? que se exprimem tambщm atravщs do corpo fэsico destes assentamentos, que comeчam a mudar e a assumir lѓgicas de estabilizaчуo e reorganizaчуo. O trabalho se propѕe a afrontar de modo sistemсtico e rigoroso a leitura deste fenєmeno, analisando de um ponto de vista morfolѓgico o tecido urbano de quatro favelas do Rio de janeiro, тmbito de observaчуo privilegiado a respeito da informalidade. Estes territѓrios, depois de terem sido longamente atravessados, observados, levantados, mapeados e redesenhados, sуo analisados em escala territorial, para sondar as incidъncias do enraizamento nas metrѓpoles, e em escala espacial, para identificar e compreender as sintaxes de evoluчуo e de micro transformaчуo de seu tecido urbano. A ideia de base do trabalho щ a de olhar estes territѓrios, atщ entуo nуo explorados com a necessсria precisуo pela literatura cientэfica, com ?olhos de arquiteto?, superando o muro representado pela hipercomplexidade, marginalidade e dificuldade de acesso. O fim щ o de construir um especэfico e inщdito ?catсlogo informal? que reњna o patrimєnio de aчѕes, formas e espaчos urbanos gerados ?dentro do enraizamento?, e utilizсvel como instrumento de conhecimento e interpretaчуo rigoroso da informalidade. As temсticas confrontadas neste estudo buscam dar uma significativa contribuiчуo ? se nуo uma resposta ? a questѕes de particular atualidade no debate cientэfico: quais cenсrios urbanos se geram a partir do enraizamento informal? Qual gramсtica urbana e espacial se geram? Pode a teoria urbana absover estas novas questѕes e traduzэ-las em precisos mщtodos de aчуo de projeto?

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-LIVRO.TITULO-DO-LIVRO: Informal rooting. Un atlante in divenire
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-LIVRO.TITULO-DO-LIVRO-INGLES: Informal rooting. Un atlante in divenire

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria da Arquitetura

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-3.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Planejamento e Projeto do Espaчo Urbano

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This work is based on the observation that within contemporary metropolises, there is a worldwide rooting process of informal cities which are structured around themselves and persist; they settle in the collective imagery producing a new social-cultural mutation. This paradigm shift is more and more triggering processes of ?non-replacement? which can also be observed on the physical pattern of these settlements that begin to mutate and adapt to the logic of stabilization and reorganization. This work is intended to deal systematically and accurately with the interpretation of this phenomenon, analyzing in morphological terms the urban tissue of four favelas in Rio de Janeiro, a favorable context from which the informality can be observed. After having traveled across these territories for a long time, after having observed them, surveyed the land, mapped them, redrawn them, they are analyzed on a territorial scale, in order to explore the incidence of the rooting process on the metropolis, and on a spatial scale, in order to detect and understand the syntax of the evolution and the micro-transformation of their urban tissue. The basic idea is to observe these territories, not yet explored, with the accuracy required by scientific literature, through the ?eyes of the architect?, overcoming the wall of the unknowable represented by the hyper-complexity, the marginalization and the difficulty to access these territories. The aim is to create a specific and new ?informal catalog? that gathers the heritage of actions, forms and urban spaces created ?within the rooting process?, and that can be used to accurately know and interpret the informality. This study deals with issues that aim at giving a significant contribution ? or even an answer ? to particularly recent questions discussed within the scientific debate: what kind of urban settings does the informal rooting anticipate? What kind of urban and spatial grammar does it unfold? Can the urban theory assimilate these

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria da Arquitetura

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The pandemic has highlighted the extent to which our built environment (houses, schools, hospitals, and public space) is unable to cope with this tragic event. Similarly, our urban realm has been shown to be inadequate in confronting the other dangers we face, such as the climate crisis or the fragility of the environment. In these situations, architecture is given the task of imagining and designing the environments and places that will frame our lives: not just buildings for the few ? expensive, bespoke and for limited areas of the world or of the city ? but solutions that improve the quality of life for the greatest possible number of people. These solutions must also be able to interpret the characteristics of diverse places and climates without renouncing architecture?s creativity and history.

Our current situation, which has put many of our everyday activities on hold, can be an important opportunity to rethink our way of life. As is the case every year, Wave will act not only as important international learning activity for the participating students, but as a collective laboratory addressing current themes. What theme could be more topical than the terrible disease that has affected the entire planet?

Wave 2020 will be the first architectural workshop to focus on post-Covid scenarios, a subject that is bound to occupy architects and urban planners in the coming years. The viewpoint of the architects and urban planners who will participate from different continents and who, together with the students, are living in this present condition, will give rise ? as it does every year ? to the development and exchange of a vast number of ideas and solutions. Once again, this prestigious architectural design workshop will demonstrate how architecture can be a tool for both understanding and improving the world.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Antilia is a curatorial project conducted by PROFFERLO architecture.
The aim of the project is the creation of a space in which to discuss, undermine and investigate the idea of landscape. Artists, architects and photographers will participate with multiple interpretations on the subject, just as the countless theories on Antilia. The island that is permeated by myths and legends, scientific rigour and imagination.
Antilia is a travelling gallery. The venue for the first twelve months was in Gioia del Colle (BA), in a so-called sottano located at the edge of the historic centre. Then Moved to Bitonto, Ruvo, Treviso and so on. Antilia is a legendary island with an indefinite form and place, where new visions and stories on the landscape will land.
the Gallery would travel to different locations where spaces are neglected. The spaces would then be injected with events and exhibitions as a way to regenerate the decaying urban spaces in Southern Italy and elsewhere

No entanto, essas limitaчѕes, alщm de evidenciar por um lado o papel indispensсvel da comunicaчуo verbal e gestual no campo do ensino e da pesquisa arquitetєnica, por outro lado impulsionaram, como nunca antes, as interaчѕes entre ferramentas de transmissуo remota, mщtodos de documentaчуo e rastreabilidade das atividades desenvolvidas em cooperaчуo entre pessoas em diferentes lugares, pertencentes a culturas e disciplinas muitas vezes distantes umas das outras.
